title: Linear Search: Predicate Version
description: Implement `findIndex(arr, predicate)` that returns the first index where `predicate(arr[i])` is true, or -1 if none match.

easy: Line 2: for (let i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) {
medium: Loop through each element with index i
Call predicate(arr[i]) to test the element
If predicate returns true, return the index
If no element passes the test, return -1
hard: Instead of comparing with a value, you call a function
The predicate function tests each element
Think of it like level 1, but more flexible
